thoughts.text: I think we should use the 'write_to_file' command to write a timestamp to the filename of the output file generated by the 'river_simulation.py' script.
thoughts.reasoning: We just used the 'read_file' command to read the output file generated by the 'river_simulation.py' script, and we want to make it easier to distinguish between different runs of the script. We can use the 'write_to_file' command to write a timestamp to the filename of the output file generated by the script.
thoughts.plan: - Use the 'write_to_file' command to write a timestamp to the filename of the output file generated by the 'river_simulation.py' script.
thoughts.criticism: I should have thought to include a timestamp in the filename of the output file earlier.

args.text: The river is flowing south at a speed of 9 units per second.
